body_html:
@leplatrem announced uptake telemetry on a bunch of Firefox lists today. It helps measure uptake of update systems via Telemetry histograms. It looks rad.

This is totally a thing we want to know about Shield. We should use this.

@leplatrem With Shield, we deliver and execute several recipes when out client hits our service. Some may fail while others may succeed. Is uptake telemetry suitable for measuring the uptake of each individual recipe? Could we add a unique per-recipe identifier to the source name when calling the API? Or is it more suitable for measuring uptake of the service as a whole?

Also, for Telemetry I'm mostly familiar with ATMO and ReDash. How are we expected to view the data being sent?

CC @rhelmer since he might be more familiar with Shield and was involved in uptake telemetry.
title: Implement uptake telemetry
